p: Amino acids, alkaloids, glycopeptides, terpenoids, peptidoglycan, glycosides, carbohydrates, hypoglycans, polysaccharides, galactomannan gum, guanidine, and steroids are some of the main active constituents derived from medicinal plants that have anti-diabetic activity. 9 Anti-hyperglycemic and anti-dyslipidemia activities of these secondary metabolites are accredited by several mechanisms such as improving the function of pancreatic beta-cells. 10
